QUOTE: The single most important distinction in life... is to distinguish between an opportunity to be seized and a temptation to be resisted.
AUTHOR: Rabbi Lord Jonathan Sacks

QUOTE: The best life is the one in which the creative impulses play the largest part and the possessive impulses the smallest.
AUTHOR: Bertrand Russell

QUOTE: And therein lies the whole of man’s plight. Human time does not turn in a circle; it runs ahead in a straight line. That is why man cannot be happy: happiness is the longing for repetition.
AUTHOR: Milan Kundera

QUOTE: If we have learned one thing from the history of invention and discovery, it is that, in the long run — and often in the short one — the most daring prophecies seem laughably conservative.
AUTHOR: Arthur C. Clarke

QUOTE: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
AUTHOR: Stephen Hawking

QUOTE: Tradition is the passing on of the fire and not the worship of the ashes.
AUTHOR: Thomas More

QUOTE: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
AUTHOR: Pablo Picasso

QUOTE: In the endless quest for more, leave space to find what you already have.
AUTHOR: JM

QUOTE: To avoid any confusion, Amazon's FulFillment Centres are referring to stuff, not life.
AUTHOR: JM?

QUOTE: You don't need to worry about progressing slowly. You need to worry about climbing the wrong mountain.
AUTHOR: James Clear

QUOTE: Forgiveness is accepting the apology that you will never receive.
AUTHOR: lots of people

QUOTE: Those who make peaceful revolution impossible will make violent revolution inevitable.
AUTHOR: JFK

QUOTE: Don't let the fear of the time it will take to accomplish something stand in the way of your doing it. The time will pass anyway; we might just as well put that passing time to the best possible use.
AUTHOR: Earl Nightingale

QUOTE: The proper function of man is to live, not to exist. I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them. I shall use my time.
AUTHOR: Jack London

QUOTE: Most people end up being conformists; they adapt to prison life. A few become reformers; they fight for better lighting, better ventilation. Hardly anyone becomes a rebel, a revolutionary who breaks down the prison walls. You can only be a revolutionary when you see the prison walls in the first place.
AUTHOR: Anthony de Mello

QUOTE: I have learned that whenever I think I don't have enough time to do that what I usually mean is I don't have enough energy or I am not actually interested in doing this.
AUTHOR: James Clear

QUOTE: What I need to do a better job of is not managing my time, but rather caring for myself and identifying my true interests. When I am well rested and working on something I am genuinely excited about, finding time is rarely a problem.
AUTHOR: James Clear

QUOTE: It is not enough that we do our best; sometimes we must do what is required.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: The secret to doing good research is always to be a little underemployed. You waste years by not being able to waste hours.
AUTHOR: Amos Tversky

QUOTE: Bureaucracy is a construction by which a person is conveniently separated from the consequences of his or her actions.
AUTHOR: Nassim Taleb, Bed Of Procrustes

QUOTE: It's hard to remember that this day will never come again. That the time is now and the place is here and that there are no second chances at a single moment.
AUTHOR: Jeanette Winterson

QUOTE: Pessimism is an indulgence, orthodoxy is the enemy of invention, despair an insult to the imagination.
AUTHOR: Wade Davis

QUOTE: Between stimulus and response lies all the potential of humanity.
AUTHOR: JM (or someone else)

QUOTE: Absorb what is useful, discard what is useless, and add what is specifically your own.
AUTHOR: Bruce Lee

QUOTE: People usually consider walking on water or in thin air a miracle. But I think the real miracle is not to walk either on water or in thin air, but to walk on earth. Every day we are engaged in a miracle which we don’t even recognize: a blue sky, white clouds, green leaves, the black, curious eyes of a child — our own two eyes. All is a miracle.
AUTHOR: Thích Nhất Hạnh, The Miracle of Mindfulness: An Introduction to the Practice of Meditation

QUOTE: Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies, in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and not clothed.
AUTHOR: Dwight D. Eisenhower

QUOTE: One day you will wake up and there won’t be any more time to do the things you’ve always wanted. Do it now.
AUTHOR: Pail Coehlo

QUOTE: Do not stare into laser beam (or neutron beam) with remaining eye.
AUTHOR: Anon

QUOTE: Embrace your losses as fair payment for the surplus of being alive.
AUTHOR: Kieran Setiya

QUOTE: Bad men need nothing more to compass their ends, than that good men should look on and do nothing.
AUTHOR: John Stuart Mill

QUOTE: The standard you walk past is the standard you accept.
AUTHOR: Lt-Gen David Morrison

QUOTE: Anyone who believes in indefinite growth on a physically finite planet is either mad or an economist.
AUTHOR: David Attenborough

QUOTE: What you leave behind is not what is engraved in stone monuments, but what is woven into the lives of others.
AUTHOR: Pericles

QUOTE: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
AUTHOR: Soren Kierkegaard

QUOTE: The empires of the future are the empires of the mind.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: For every complex problem there is an answer that is clear, simple, and wrong.
AUTHOR: H. L. Mencken

QUOTE: Markets can remain irrational longer than you can remain solvent.
AUTHOR: John Maynard Keynes

QUOTE: The road to hell is not paved with good intentions. It is paved with lack of intention.
AUTHOR: Dr. Gabor Maté

QUOTE: Forgiveness is accepting the apology you will never receive.
AUTHOR: Shawne Duperon

QUOTE: I would rather have questions that can’t be answered than answers that can’t be questioned.
AUTHOR: Richard Feynman

QUOTE: I tell you: one must have chaos in oneself to give birth to a dancing star.
AUTHOR: From Thus Spoke Zarathustra by Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: We hang the petty thieves and appoint the great ones to public office.
AUTHOR: Aesop

QUOTE: Destroying rainforest for economic gain is like burning a Renaissance painting to cook a meal.
AUTHOR: E. O. Wilson

QUOTE: Knowledge is like string - you can't push it into peoples heads, they have to pull it in themselves.
AUTHOR: JM

QUOTE: The first lesson of economics is scarcity: there is never enough of anything to fully satisfy all those who want it. The first lesson of politics is to disregard the first lesson of economics.
AUTHOR: Thomas Sowell

QUOTE: As a child I woke each day hoping that the adults would fix the problems of the world. Then one day I woke up and realised that I was the adult.
AUTHOR: JM

QUOTE: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
AUTHOR: William Arthur Ward

QUOTE: The greater danger for most of us lies not in setting our aim too high and falling short; but in setting our aim too low, and achieving our mark.
AUTHOR: Michelangelo

QUOTE: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
AUTHOR: Epictetus

QUOTE: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
AUTHOR: Lewis Carroll

QUOTE: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Bonaparte

QUOTE: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: You get ideas when you ask yourself simple questions. The most important of the questions is just, ‘What if...?’.
AUTHOR: Neil Gaiman

QUOTE: Money comes and goes, but time only goes.
AUTHOR: B. Jeffrey Madoff

QUOTE: Given some of the choices we’re making, we have no proof that real intelligence exists on Earth!.
AUTHOR: Dennis McKenna

QUOTE: For the classics, philosophical insight was the product of a life of leisure; for me, a life of leisure is the product of philosophical insight.
AUTHOR: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

QUOTE: The art of life is to know how to enjoy a little and to endure much.
AUTHOR: William Hazlitt

QUOTE: My own suspicion is that the universe is not only queerer than we suppose, but queerer than we can suppose.
AUTHOR: J.B.S. Haldane

QUOTE: Freedom from oppression does not equal freedom from obligation.
AUTHOR: Sebastian Junger

QUOTE: Choice is what happens in the space between the stimulus and the response.
AUTHOR: Viktor Frankl

QUOTE: If you want to go fast, go alone, but if you want to go far, go together.
AUTHOR: African proverb(?)

QUOTE: Choose those who seek purpose, not those who seek power; for inside all of use are both angels and monsters.
AUTHOR: Anonymous

QUOTE: And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, ‘If this isn’t nice, I don’t know what is.’.
AUTHOR: Kurt Vonnegut

QUOTE: Like our stomachs, our minds are hurt more often by overeating than by hunger.
AUTHOR: Petrarch

QUOTE: There are those that look at things the way they are and ask why. I dream of things that never were, and ask why not?
AUTHOR: Robert F. Kennedy

QUOTE: Do as little as needed, not as much as possible.
AUTHOR: Henk Kraaijenhof

QUOTE: Those who know HOW, will always have a job. Those who know WHY will always be their boss.
AUTHOR: John Thompson

QUOTE: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
AUTHOR: Seneca

QUOTE: Easy choices, hard life — hard choices, easy life.
AUTHOR: Jerzy Gregorek

QUOTE: You can fail at what you don't love, so you may as well fail at what you do love.
AUTHOR: Jim Carrey

QUOTE: One of the great mistakes is to judge policies and programmes by their intentions rather than their results.
AUTHOR: Milton Friedman

QUOTE: We don't rise to the level of our expectations, we fall to the level of our training.
AUTHOR: Archilochus

QUOTE: If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe.
AUTHOR: Carl Sagan

QUOTE: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do, and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
AUTHOR: George Patton

QUOTE: Only when the last tree has been cut down, the last fish been caught, and the last stream poisoned, will we realize we cannot eat money.
AUTHOR: Cree Indian Prophecy

QUOTE: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
AUTHOR: Coco Chanel

QUOTE: I think everybody should get rich and famous, and do everything they ever dreamed of, so they can see that it’s not the answer.
AUTHOR: Jim Carrey

QUOTE: The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.
AUTHOR: David Foster Wallace

QUOTE: Fools learn from experience. I prefer to learn from the experience of others.
AUTHOR: Otto von Bismarck

QUOTE: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies but the silence of our friends.
AUTHOR: Martin Luther King junior

QUOTE: We are defined by the places that we hold in the web of others' lives.
AUTHOR: Ken Liu

QUOTE: Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength.
AUTHOR: Corrie ten Boom

QUOTE: Then out spake brave Horatius; The captain of the gate To every man upon this earth, death cometh soon or late, And how can man die better, Than facing fearful odds, for the ashes of his fathers, And the temples of his gods.
AUTHOR: Thomas Babington Macaulay

QUOTE: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge.
AUTHOR: Charles Darwin

QUOTE: With despair, true optimism begins: the optimism of the man who expects nothing, who knows he has no rights and nothing coming to him, who rejoices in counting on himself alone and in acting alone for the good of all.
AUTHOR: Jean-Paul Sartre

QUOTE: The willow submits to the wind and prospers until one day it is many willows — a wall against the wind.
AUTHOR: Frank Herbert, Dune

QUOTE: Change is certain. Progress is not.
AUTHOR: E.H. Carr

QUOTE: Don't ask what the world needs, ask what makes you come alive. Because what the world needs most, is more people who come alive.
AUTHOR: Howard Thurman

QUOTE: The real problem of humanity is the following: we have paleolithic emotions; medieval institutions; and god-like technology.
AUTHOR: E. O. Wilson

QUOTE: Democracy is a system in which heads are counted but not weighed.
AUTHOR: Muhammad Iqbal

QUOTE: Culture eats strategy for breakfast.
AUTHOR: Peter Drucker

QUOTE: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.
AUTHOR: André Gide

QUOTE: Use only that which works, and take it from any place you can find it.
AUTHOR: Bruce Lee

QUOTE: What do minor misfortunes and setbacks on the way matter to me when I know that to be happy is not to pass life by.
AUTHOR: Aleksandr Tvardovsky

QUOTE: How we labour at our daily work more ardently and thoughtlessly than is necessary to sustain our life because it is even more necessary not to have leisure stop and think.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were, but without it we go nowhere.
AUTHOR: Carl Sagan

QUOTE: The best that most of us can hope to achieve in physics is simply to misunderstand at a deeper level.
AUTHOR: Wolfgang Pauli

QUOTE: Nothing is so easy as to find fault with human institutions; nothing so difficult as to suggest adequate practical improvements.
AUTHOR: Thomas Malthus

QUOTE: Absence is to love as wind is to fire: it extinguishes the little flame, it fans the big.
AUTHOR: Umberto Eco

QUOTE: When wireless is perfectly applied, the whole earth will be converted into a huge brain.
AUTHOR: Nikola Tesla

QUOTE: Often it isn’t the mountains ahead that wear you out, it’s the little pebble in your shoe.
AUTHOR: Muhammad Ali

QUOTE: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
AUTHOR: Edgar Allan Poe

QUOTE: In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act.
AUTHOR: George Orwell

QUOTE: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.
AUTHOR: Marcus Tullius Cicero

QUOTE: There is no limit to the amount of good you can do if you don’t care who gets the credit.
AUTHOR: Ronald Reagan

QUOTE: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
AUTHOR: Thomas Edison

QUOTE: A professional is someone who can do his best work when he doesn’t feel like it.
AUTHOR: Alistair Cooke

QUOTE: Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It’s the transition that’s troublesome.
AUTHOR: Isaac Asimov

QUOTE: Our imagination flies — we are its shadow on the earth.
AUTHOR: Vladimir Nabokov

QUOTE: Politics is not the art of the possible. It consists in choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
AUTHOR: John Kenneth Galbraith

QUOTE: Life is like a game of cards. The hand that is dealt you is determinism; the way you play it is free will.
AUTHOR: Jawaharlal Nehru

QUOTE: You teach me, I forget. You show me, I remember. You involve me, I understand.
AUTHOR: Edward O. Wilson

QUOTE: Reality is the leading cause of stress among those in touch with it.
AUTHOR: Lily Tomlin

QUOTE: I do not yet know of a man who became a leader as a result of having undergone a leadership course.
AUTHOR: Lee Kuan Yew

QUOTE: I would rather have questions that can't be answered than answers which can't be questioned.
AUTHOR: Richard Feynman

QUOTE: If you aren’t in over your head, how do you know how tall you are?
AUTHOR: T. S. Eliot

QUOTE: Relying on the government to protect your privacy is like asking a peeping tom to install your window blinds.
AUTHOR: John Perry Barlow

QUOTE: The opposite of a correct statement is a false statement. But the opposite of a profound truth may well be another profound truth.
AUTHOR: Niels Bohr

QUOTE: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: A desk is a dangerous place from which to view the world.
AUTHOR: John Le Carré

QUOTE: Will what is necessary, love what you will.
AUTHOR: Tim O'Reilly

QUOTE: The fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses.
AUTHOR: Carl Sagan

QUOTE: Burn old wood, read old books, drink old wines, have old friends.
AUTHOR: Alfonso X of Castile

QUOTE: It is infinitely better to have a few good men than many indifferent ones.
AUTHOR: George Washington

QUOTE: Government is the entertainment division of the military-industrial complex.
AUTHOR: Frank Zappa

QUOTE: In the end, only three things matter: how much you loved, how gently you lived, and how gracefully you let go of things not meant for you.
AUTHOR: Jack Kornfield

QUOTE: All of humanity’s problems stem from man’s inability to sit quietly in a room alone.
AUTHOR: Blaise Pascal

QUOTE: The best thing to do with the best things in life is give them up.
AUTHOR: Dorothy Day

QUOTE: Pain is inevitable, suffering is optional.
AUTHOR: Haruki Murakami

QUOTE: What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of winter to give it sweetness.
AUTHOR: John Steinbeck

QUOTE: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
AUTHOR: William James

QUOTE: Love people, use things, because the opposite never works.
AUTHOR: Joshua Fields Millburn

QUOTE: I wish everyone could become rich and famous so that they could realise that it is not the answer.
AUTHOR: Jim Carrey

QUOTE: Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you’re exactly the same.
AUTHOR: Audrey Hepburn

QUOTE: It is no measure of health to be well-adjusted to a profoundly sick society.
AUTHOR: Jiddu Krishnamurti

QUOTE: We are like butterflies who flutter for a day and think it's forever.
AUTHOR: Carl Sagan

QUOTE: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
AUTHOR: Isaac Asimov

QUOTE: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
AUTHOR: Chuang-Tzu

QUOTE: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
AUTHOR: Mae West

QUOTE: Action expresses priorities.
AUTHOR: Ghandi

QUOTE: To live only for some future goal is shallow. It’s the sides of the mountain that sustain life, not the top.
AUTHOR: Robert Pirsig

QUOTE: Before I can live with other folks I’ve got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn’t abide by majority rule is a person’s conscience.
AUTHOR: Harper Lee

QUOTE: I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours.
AUTHOR: Jerome K. Jerome

QUOTE: Don't postpone joy until you have learned all of your lessons. Joy is your lesson.
AUTHOR: Alan Cohen

QUOTE: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: The universe is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
AUTHOR: Eden Phillpotts

QUOTE: Hanlon’s Razor states that we should not attribute to malice that which is more easily explained by stupidity.
AUTHOR: Robert J. Hanlon

QUOTE: There are two ways to get enough. One is to continue to accumulate more and more. The other is to desire less.
AUTHOR: G.K. Chesterton

QUOTE: Happiness is like a butterfly which, when pursued, is always beyond our grasp, but, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.
AUTHOR: Nathaniel Hawthorne

QUOTE: I should be suspicious of what I want.
AUTHOR: Rumi

QUOTE: The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up.
AUTHOR: Paul Valéry

QUOTE: We swallow greedily any lie that flatters us, but we sip only little by little at a truth we find bitter.
AUTHOR: Denis Diderot

QUOTE: How small the vastest of human catastrophes may seem at a distance of a few million miles.
AUTHOR: H.G. Wells

QUOTE: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: To achieve great things, two things are needed: a plan and not quite enough time.
AUTHOR: Leonard Bernstein

QUOTE: A person is a fool to become a writer. His only compensation is absolute freedom.
AUTHOR: Roald Dahl

QUOTE: The truth knocks on the door and you say, ‘Go away, I'm looking for the truth,’ and so it goes away. Puzzling.
AUTHOR: Robert M. Pirsig

QUOTE: Time engraves our faces with all the tears we have not shed.
AUTHOR: Natalie Clifford Barney

QUOTE: If hard work is not another name for talent, it is the best possible substitute for it.
AUTHOR: James Garfield

QUOTE: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.
AUTHOR: Epicurus

QUOTE: There are no passengers on spaceship earth. We are all crew.
AUTHOR: Marshall McLuhan

QUOTE: Far and away the best prize that life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
AUTHOR: Theodore Roosevelt

QUOTE: If liberty means anything at all, it means the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.
AUTHOR: - George Orwell

QUOTE: The only thing that makes life possible is permanent, intolerable uncertainty: not knowing what comes next.
AUTHOR: Ursula K. Le Guin

QUOTE: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
AUTHOR: Galileo Galilei

QUOTE: ‘The future is already here — it’s just not evenly distributed’.
AUTHOR: William Gibson

QUOTE: Never fail to know that if you are doing all the talking, you are boring somebody.
AUTHOR: Helen Gurley Brown

QUOTE: Bravery is not being afraid to be afraid.
AUTHOR: Marie Colvin

QUOTE: Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen.
AUTHOR: John Steinbeck

QUOTE: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself – and you are the easiest person to fool.
AUTHOR: Richard Feynman

QUOTE: Today I shall behave, as if this is the day I will be remembered.
AUTHOR: Dr. Seuss

QUOTE: Happiness is to take up the struggle in the midst of the raging storm and not to pluck the lute in the moonlight or recite poetry among the blossoms.
AUTHOR: Ding Ling

QUOTE: Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving.
AUTHOR: Terry Pratchett

QUOTE: The only way to escape the corruptible effect of praise is to go on working.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: The secret to doing good research is always to be a little underemployed. You waste years by not being able to waste hours.
AUTHOR: Amos Tversky

QUOTE: To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.
AUTHOR: T.S. Eliot

QUOTE: A mind all logic is like a knife all blade. It makes the hand bleed that uses it.
AUTHOR: Rabindranath Tagore

QUOTE: To be angry, is to revenge the fault of others upon ourselves.
AUTHOR: Alexander Pope

QUOTE: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: The trick is not to learn from your mistakes, but to learn from those of others.
AUTHOR: JM

QUOTE: Everyday, remember what you already have.
AUTHOR: JM

QUOTE: What do you despise? By this are you truly known.
AUTHOR: Frank Herbert, Dune

QUOTE: You are not alone. And just because you feel like shit doesn’t mean you are shit.
AUTHOR: Jerry Colonna

QUOTE: To live in hearts we leave behind, is not to die.
AUTHOR: Thomas Campbell

QUOTE: There are times when it is best to be content with what one has, so as not to lose everything.
AUTHOR: José Saramago

QUOTE: Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.
AUTHOR: Anne Lamott

QUOTE: You can’t stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
AUTHOR: Jon Kabat-Zinn

QUOTE: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw
